title: Probability and Data Analysis

vocab.definition: The likelihood that an event will occur
A possible result of an experiment
All possible outcomes of an experiment
An event made up of two or more simple events
Events where one outcome doesn't affect the other

teachingNotes: Use dice, coins, and cards for examples. Connect probability to fractions and percents. Discuss real-world applications.

sample.question: What is the likelihood that an event will occur?

truefalse.question: The probability of any event is between 0 and 1.

multiplechoice.question: What is the probability of rolling a 3 on a six-sided die?

fillintheblank.question: All possible outcomes of an experiment make up the ________ space.

shortanswer.question: If you flip two coins, what is the probability of getting two heads?

wordProblems.question: A bag has 3 red marbles and 7 blue marbles. What is the probability of drawing a red marble?
